Quotes: Reading, after a certain age, diverts the mind too much from its creative pursuits. Any man who reads too much and uses his own brain too little falls into lazy habits of thinking.
Author: Albert Einstein

Quotes: It is better to understand little than to misunderstand a lot.
Author: Anatole France

Quotes: One thing above all gives charm to men's thoughts, and this is unrest. A mind that is not uneasy irritates and bores me.
Author: Anatole France

Quotes: It is the mark of an educated mind to be able to entertain a thought without accepting it.
Author: Aristotel

Quotes: It is just that we should be grateful, not only to those with whose views we may agree, but also to those who have expressed more superficial views;for these also contributed something, by developing before us the powers of thought.
Author: Aristotel

Quotes: Remember that credit is money.
Author: Benjamin Franklin

Quotes: An idea, like a ghost, must be spoken to a little before it will explain itself.
Author: Charles Dickens

Quotes: We think too much and feel too little.
Author: Charlie Chaplin

Quotes: To live is to think.
Author: Cicero

Quotes: As I approve of a youth that has something of the old man in him, so I am no less pleased with an old man that has something of the youth. He that follows this rule may be old in body, but can never be so in mind.
Author: Cicero

Quotes: The more man meditates upon good thoughts, the better will be his world and the world at large.
Author: Confucius

Quotes: I hear and I forget. I see and I remember. I do and I understand.
Author: Confucius

Quotes: A people represents not so much an aggregate of ideas and theories as of obsessions.
Author: Emil Cioran

Quotes: The shortest answer is doing the thing.
Author: Ernest Hemingway

Quotes: The principal point of cleverness is to know how to value things just as they deserve.
Author: Francois de La Rochefoucauld

Quotes: In everything one thing is impossible: rationality.
Author: Friedrich Nietzsche

Quotes: Thoughts are the shadows of our feelings - always darker, emptier and simpler.
Author: Friedrich Nietzsche

Quotes: We often refuse to accept an idea merely because the tone of voice in which it has been expressed is unsympathetic to us.
Author: Friedrich Nietzsche

Quotes: When one has finished building one's house, one suddenly realizes that in the process one has learned something that one really needed to know in the worst way - before one began.
Author: Friedrich Nietzsche

Quotes: We must always think about things, and we must think about things as they are, not as they are said to be.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quotes: Each generation imagines itself to be more intelligent than the one that went before it, and wiser than the one that comes after it.
Author: George Orwell

Quotes: Not to expose your true feelings to an adult seems to be instinctive from the age of seven or eight onwards.
Author: George Orwell

Quotes: I have a mind to join a club and beat you over the head with it.
Author: Groucho Marx

Quotes: When everything seems to be going against you, remember that the airplane takes off against the wind, not with it.
Author: Henry Ford

Quotes: Thoughts without content are empty, intuitions without concepts are blind.
Author: Immanuel Kant

Quotes: Remorse sleeps during prosperity but awakes bitter consciousness during adversity.
Author: Jean Jacques Rousseau

Quotes: A clever man commits no minor blunders.
Author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

Quotes: All intelligent thoughts have already been thought;what is necessary is only to try to think them again.
Author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

Quotes: I think that I am better than the people who are trying to reform me.
Author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

Quotes: Behavior is the mirror in which everyone shows their image.
Author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

Quotes: Every spoken word arouses our self-will.
Author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

Quotes: Like many intellectuals, he was incapable of saying a simple thing in a simple way.
Author: Marcel Proust

Quotes: The paradoxes of today are the prejudices of tomorrow, since the most benighted and the most deplorable prejudices have had their moment of novelty when fashion lent them its fragile grace.
Author: Marcel Proust

Quotes: I must have a prodigious quantity of mind;it takes me as much as a week sometimes to make it up.
Author: Mark Twain

Quotes: It was wonderful to find America, but it would have been more wonderful to miss it.
Author: Mark Twain

Quotes: Drag your thoughts away from your troubles... by the ears, by the heels, or any other way you can manage it.
Author: Mark Twain

Quotes: One ought to look a good deal at oneself before thinking of condemning others.
Author: Moliere

Quotes: A man who does not think for himself does not think at all.
Author: Oscar Wilde

Quotes: To expect the unexpected shows a thoroughly modern intellect.
Author: Oscar Wilde

Quotes: An idea that is not dangerous is unworthy of being called an idea at all.
Author: Oscar Wilde

Quotes: There is only one class in the community that thinks more about money than the rich, and that is the poor. The poor can think of nothing else.
Author: Oscar Wilde

Quotes: I can stand brute force, but brute reason is quite unbearable. There is something unfair about its use. It is hitting below the intellect.
Author: Oscar Wilde

Quotes: I begin with an idea and then it becomes something else.
Author: Pablo Picasso

Quotes: You have to have an idea of what you are going to do, but it should be a vague idea.
Author: Pablo Picasso

Quotes: An idea is a point of departure and no more. As soon as you elaborate it, it becomes transformed by thought.
Author: Pablo Picasso

Quotes: He can who thinks he can, and he can't who thinks he can't. This is an inexorable, indisputable law.
Author: Pablo Picasso

Quotes: Man's great misfortune is that he has no organ, no kind of eyelid or brake, to mask or block a thought, or all thought, when he wants to.
Author: Paul Valery

Quotes: The history of thought may be summed up in these words: it is absurd by what it seeks and great by what it finds.
Author: Paul Valery

Quotes: A thought is an idea in transit.
Author: Pitagora

Quotes: The excessive increase of anything causes a reaction in the opposite direction.
Author: Plato

Quotes: Everything comes to us that belongs to us if we create the capacity to receive it.
Author: Rabindranath Tagore

Quotes: I have fun with ideas;I play with them.
Author: Ray Bradbury

Quotes: The glow of one warm thought is to me worth more than money.
Author: Thomas Jefferson

Quotes: To contemplate is to look at shadows.
Author: Victor Hugo

Quotes: One can resist the invasion of an army but one cannot resist the invasion of ideas.
Author: Victor Hugo

Quotes: The omnipotence of evil has never resulted in anything but fruitless efforts. Our thoughts always escape from whoever tries to smother them.
Author: Victor Hugo

Quotes: The eyes of others our prisons;their thoughts our cages.
Author: Virginia Woolf

Quotes: He must be very ignorant for he answers every question he is asked.
Author: Voltaire

Quotes: Men hate the individual whom they call avaricious only because nothing can be gained from him.
Author: Voltaire

Quotes: One great use of words is to hide our thoughts.
Author: Voltaire

Quotes: Men use thought only as authority for their injustice, and employ speech only to conceal their thoughts.
Author: Voltaire

Quotes: Give thy thoughts no tongue.
Author: William Shakespeare

Quotes: He that is giddy thinks the world turns round.
Author: William Shakespeare
